newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy state railways lose 3.84 trln lire in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Italy state railways lose 3.84 trln lire in 1996.

text.p: Italy's state-owned rail company Ferrovie dello Stato (FS) lost 3.84 trillion lire at the parent level last year against a 1.58 trillion lire loss in 1995, the company said in a statement on Monday.
At a consolidated level, FS plunged 3.90 trillion lire into the red.

The railway said its results had been weighed down by a decision to put aside 2.2 trillion lire of funds in case the government decided to withhold transfers of cash to the company in a bid to keep the state deficit down.
Prime Minister Romano Prodi has indicated that transfer of funds to state bodies may be cut in the 1998 budget.
FS said parent company turnover was 14.04 trillion lire in 1996, while group turnover hit 14.75 trillion lire.

Personnel costs rose 9.5 percent to 950 billion lire despite a 3,000 reduction in the workforce from end-1995 levels. The statement said the jump in costs was largely due to a switch in contracts offered to employees.
In the first five months of 1997, freight traffic rose 4.2 percent, in terms of tonnes moved per kilometre, compared with the same period last year.
The statement added that passenger traffic also increased between January and May, but did not specify by how much.
